description: Detects markers of deception, manipulation, and disinformation. Analyzes source authenticity, content manipulation, psychological tactics, logical fallacies, and narrative manipulation patterns. Assesses likelihood of intentional deception vs. honest error. Essential for counter-disinformation analysis.
researcher_question: Are there signs this content may be manipulative, deceptive, or part of a disinformation campaign?

overall_assessment.authenticity_score: number (0-1) - 1 is fully authentic, 0 is entirely manipulated
overall_assessment.manipulation_likelihood: none detected | low | medium | high | confirmed
overall_assessment.primary_concern_type: string - main category of manipulation if any

indicators.indicator_type: fake_source | misattributed | sock_puppet | astroturfing | anonymity_abuse | credential_inflation | impersonation
fabrication | selective_editing | out_of_context | doctored_evidence | false_attribution | synthetic_content | cherry_picking | quote_mining
indicators.original_vs_manipulated: string - if determinable, what was changed

indicators.indicator_type: fear_appeal | false_urgency | emotional_manipulation | identity_appeal | authority_abuse | bandwagon | outrage_bait | tribal_activation | moral_panic
false_dichotomy | strawman | ad_hominem | appeal_to_authority | circular_reasoning | false_equivalence | slippery_slope | whataboutism | gish_gallop | moving_goalposts
indicators.apparent_intent: string - what conclusion does this push toward

indicators.indicator_type: conspiracy_framing | scapegoating | us_vs_them | victimhood_narrative | hero_narrative | decline_narrative | hidden_enemy | simple_solution_complex_problem
indicators.beneficiary: string - whose interests does this narrative serve

indicators.indicator_type: false_timeline | anachronism | manufactured_recency | outdated_presented_as_current | event_ordering_manipulation | false_precedent
synchronized_messaging | common_talking_points | artificial_amplification | cross_platform_coordination | bot_indicators | troll_farm_patterns

coordinated_campaign_indicators.campaign_assessment: string - overall campaign analysis if applicable

deception_vs_error.assessment: intentional deception | negligent error | honest mistake | cannot determine

intent_analysis.target_audience: string - who appears to be the intended audience
beneficiaries: string - who benefits if this content is believed

counterfactual_analysis.if_authentic_implications: string - what follows if content is genuine
counterfactual_analysis.if_manipulated_implications: string - what follows if content is manipulated

known_pattern_matches.pattern_name: string - e.g., 'Firehose of Falsehood', 'Dead Cat Strategy'

extraction.core_question: Are there signs this content may be manipulative, deceptive, or part of a disinformation campaign?
extraction_steps: Consider intent: manipulation or honest error?
